climbs.name: Wrath Child
climbs.fa: Bolted, Preped, and FA by Alan Collins

content.description: A four start route besides a ramp start and an awkward start onto the hard face climbing. Exiting the ramp onto the face is best describes as a process, it takes time to find a valid sequence. You dont have to exit the ramp until you are absolutely forced. Once on the face, the climbing stays on very high quality stone all the way to the top. Hard crimpy reaches lead all the way up to a roof with both good and bad holds. The second to last bolt tough to clip.
content.protection: 2 slings and 7 bolts. Anchors have fixed steel carabiners
content.location: Start off an easy ramp pitch and start clipping bolts on the face after the first bolt. most left route on the salmon colored rock face. Start in a weird chimney crack.

climbs.name: Wasted Years
climbs.fa: Bolted, Prepped, and FA by Alan Collins

content.description: Probably the highest quality and most varied route on the Maiden Oregon Wall. Climb onto a slab above the cave and clip the first bolt from a no hands stance. Then the climbing quickly turns on and is quiet bouldery for the first 5 bolts. Get one last good no hands and head into the hard 5.13 mono crux before the traverse and the heart-braking redpoint curx above the last bolt. Don't be shy to skip the last bolt, its a run but its a damn hard clip.
content.protection: Entirely Fixed. Bring a nice rope
content.location: Most left route above the cave. Start out on the left side of the cave and traverse in off the first terrace.Stay left at the y of bolt lines. The right line goes into Crowd Pleaser

climbs.name: The Trooper
climbs.fa: FA Samina Ahmed, Prepped by Alan Collins and John Collins, Bolted by Alan Collins

content.description: Find a way though a seemingly impossible start until you find the sequence. Chalked holds will make the start more obvious.  After established onto of the overhanging start, brave you way to the chains on committing 5.10 climbing.
content.protection: 7 or 8 bolts. Steel carabiners at anchors
content.location: Starts to the right of the cave two routes. First route on the right without any fixed draws.

climbs.name: Somewhere in Time
climbs.fa: FA, Bolted and Prepped by Alan Collins

content.description: Do some leisure slab moves to the first bolt before a seamlessly endless crux. Small crimps and oddly placed feet lead to a v7 crux pulling out of a mini alcove where the seam opens up. Instead of going left into 5.11 climbing, continue out right into the pumpy top of Wasted Year for a good test of pump management. (A long sling on the 7th bolt of Number of the Beast and the link up bolt will help with rope drag. I needed all the help I could get.)
content.protection: All fixed draws except the first 2
content.location: Traverse out right off the highest terrace of the Maiden Oregon Wall to a low first bolt. Continue up for 7 bolts and traverse out right for the top of Wasted Years.

climbs.name: Run to the Hills
climbs.fa: FA Chris Hatzai Bolted and prepped by Alan Collins

content.description: Start your 5.10 experience as soon as you pull off the ground, with a body position intensive 5 bolts of climbing. After the 6th bolt is clipped, the climbing eases up but the adventure continues. Mantles and cheese grating falls will keep confident climbers on there toes all the way to the chains.
content.location: Most right route on the Maiden Oregon Wall for now. Starts off semi exposed boulder on the ground.

climbs.name: Number of the Beast
climbs.fa: FA, Bolted, and Prepped by Alan Collins

content.description: Start out on a ramp that quickly steepens only to find a long series of half pad crimps. At the 5th bolt, tackle the actual crux as the pump settles in. After the crux, a heady bolt spacing guards the good rest and the 5.12 finish.
content.protection: Every draw is fixed but the bottom 4
content.location: Starts just right of the crack that splits the left side of the wall.

climbs.name: Maiden Oregon
climbs.fa: FA John Collins, Bolted and prepped by Dave McRae, Alan Collins, and John Collins

content.description:
One of the most varied 5.12a's in the park. Start off on a bouldery start with big holds. After the 5th bolt, climbing stays consistantly hard all the way to the top. Big irregular hand holds are hard to hold onto as the steepnes begins to fatigue your arms. Finish off on a steep section that clears onto a slab, where the anchors are located.

 (either have a very attentive belay passing the first bolt, or stick clip the second)
content.location: Start at the end of the right side of the cave.

climbs.name: Flight of Icarus
climbs.fa: Bolted by Alan Collins, FFA Kevin Piarulli, October 2019

content.description: Start as for Run to the Hills and move left at the second bolt. The well protected crux comes early on with technical moves though a bulge.  The second half of the route is easier, with imperfect rock and a thought-provoking finish going to the anchor.
content.location: Far right side of Maiden Oregon wall, before dropping down to the Colosseum

climbs.name: Crowd Pleaser
climbs.fa: FA and prepped by John Collins Bolted by Alan Collins

content.description: Share the start with Wasted Years and cut off right after the 4th bolt. The first 5 bolts riddles down after a couple laps, but the first time up can be perplexing. After you get the 5th bolt clipped, start into the meat of the 5.12 climbing as it continually gets harder and builds a solid pump.
content.location: Most left route above the cave. Start out on the left side of the cave and traverse in off the first terrace. Stay right at the y of bolt lines. The left line goes into Wasted Years

climbs.name: Caveman
climbs.fa: BOlted, prepped, and FA by Alan Collins

content.description: Start off the lowest point of the right side of the cave. Theres no feet for the first 5 feet due to the deep steep cave. Muster your way onto the face only to reach a harder crux at the 4th bolt. After the 5th bolt, the climbing doesn't ease up much and has lots of beta intensive movement. By the time the holds get bigger, you are pumped and on steep terrain.
content.location: Only start out of the cave on the Maiden Oregon Wall. Second most right route as of  July 2018.

content.description: A unique steep salmon colored buttress with large features and high quality rock rises above a large 5ft tall cave. An epic view overlooks Smith Rock all the way to the mountain range. As of now, the wall sees no traffic, but I suspect that will change in time. The quality routes range from 5.12a through 5.13c. Someday there will be good warm ups here. The wall is great to climb at year around. In the winter, the sun comes around noon and stays till dusk. In the summer, the wall holds morning shade till around 1pm.
